intro: Chamaenerion angustifolium subsp. macrophyllum, commonly known as the Great Willow-herb, is a flowering plant native to the northern hemisphere. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The leaves are broad and lance-shaped, with a distinctive silvery underside. It produces clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in summer. This subspecies is often found in wet or disturbed soils, such as along riverbanks and roadsides.
